column8: For In-Person Events: Name of Physical Location
column11: For In-Person Events: Location State (or Province)
column19: Webpage URL for More Information About This Event/Activity (No Links to Google Drive)
column20:
Short Summary (164 Character Limit):*
Tell prospective participants what to expect from your opportunity in a short, friendly sentence. Appears in search results.
column21:
Detailed Description of Opportunity:*
Write a public-friendly description for the web, written for an audience has no idea who you are or what this is.)
column22: Ideal images should reflect the activity participants will experience, rather than a logo. Acceptable "web friendly" formats: png, jpeg, webp. Recommended dimensions: 600√ó400 pixels.
column24: Select the engagement domain that fits your opportunity best (select ONE)*
column25: Select the activity types that fit your opportunity best (multiselect)*
column29: Select the Venue Type(s) that fit your opportunity best* (leave blank for virtual events)
column30: Select the topic(s) that fit your opportunity best*
column32: Add Keywords/Phrases. Separate with a comma. (e.g. museum, astronomy, afterschool, library, kids, citizen science, nature)
column33: Opportunity Hashtags: When people use social media to talk about and share your opportunity, what hashtags would you like them to use? (e.g. #iowasciencefest21)
column36: Facebook Page (start with http:// or https://)
